result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Roger Madland

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:20 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. Defendant Christopher Roger Madland in court.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CM466 and 22CM469. DE would like to represent himself. Court notes Waiver of Counsel previously filed in 22CM469. DE wishes to waive counsel on both matters. ADA Rockow states a pro se offer will be sent. DE updates address and states phone number on file is not his. Court sets PSC. DE doesn't drive and has to get rides to appear in court. DE requests case be dismissed. Court denies request.  gll
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher Roger Madland
Current: N8052 510th Street, Spring Valley, WI 54767 United States  (Effective: 08-02-2022)
Prior: 2088 30th Ave, Baldwin, WI 54002

- $1250 bond on file.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, 2088 30th Ave, Baldwin, WI 54002.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:45 PM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attyorney Michael Joseph becker in Court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in Court for Christopher Roger Madland. Defendant Christopher Roger Madland in court. DE confirms address and DOB. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD. DE wishes to waive right to counsel. DE to review and sign wavier of counsel. Off Record 01:48 PM. Recalled at 2:00 PM. Clerk: Lindabaur. All other appearances as previously stated. Court questions Defendant. Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to counsel. Court advises Defendant of charge and possible penalties. Bond argument; bond ordered. NG. Preserve pre-plea rights for 10 days.
